translated: and accomplish the knowledge mantra.🔽Abiding in the three vows, possessing alertness and mindfulness,

analyzed: sdom pa gsum la gnas pa dang / shes bzhin dran par ldan pa dang // 'phags pa'i nor bdun ldan pa dang // sngags kyi rgyud sde bzhi shes pas //

original: phyag rgya bzhi ldan snying rje can //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi ldan snying rje can //
translated: possessing the four seals, compassionate,

original: thabs shes yo byad tshogs pas bsgrub //
analyzed: thabs shes yo byad tshogs pas bsgrub //
translated: accomplishing with the accumulation of method and wisdom,

original: shes rab che ba /
analyzed: shes rab che ba /
translated: great wisdom,

original: stong pa nyid kyi don shes pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don shes pa /
translated: understanding the meaning of emptiness,

original: gcam phyar can ma yin pa /
analyzed: gcam phyar can ma yin pa /
translated: not deceitful,

original: rig sngags bzlas pa'i tshe smra ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rig sngags bzlas pa'i tshe smra ba ma yin pa /
translated: not speaking while reciting the knowledge mantra,

original: me'i las la mkhas pa /
analyzed: me'i las la mkhas pa /
translated: skilled in fire rituals,

original: de lta bus bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bus bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: such a one should accomplish.

original: de lta bu la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Such a one should give,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: not to others.

original: de la cho ga 'di'i thabs ni /
analyzed: de la cho ga 'di'i thabs ni /
translated: The method of this rite is as follows:

original: de la bum pa shin tu dkar ba /
analyzed: de la bum pa shin tu dkar ba /
translated: The vase should be very white,

original: gtsang ba / cho ga thams cad tshogs pa ba'i rnam lnga'i dkyil 'khor shin tu gtsang ba dri'i thig le nyer gcig / ga pur gyis byug pa byas la /
analyzed: gtsang ba / cho ga thams cad tshogs pa ba'i rnam lnga'i dkyil 'khor shin tu gtsang ba dri'i thig le nyer gcig / ga pur gyis byug pa byas la /
translated: The maṇḍala of the five pure nectars is very pure, and one should apply twenty-one drops of perfume.

original: rig sngags 'di brgya rtsa brgyad yid la ma yengs par brjod nas khrus byas sam brjod na tshe zad pa dang tshe nyams pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad nyams pa dang / bdag la mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad bsam pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'di brgya rtsa brgyad yid la ma yengs par brjod nas khrus byas sam brjod na tshe zad pa dang tshe nyams pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad nyams pa dang / bdag la mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad bsam pa zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites this awareness formula one hundred and eight times without distraction in mind, and bathes or recites it, then one's life will be extended, one's life will be enhanced, and all one's perfections will be enhanced, and all humans and non-humans will be favorably inclined toward oneself.

original: sngon gyi las kyi sgrib pa yang ma lus par zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi sgrib pa yang ma lus par zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: One's previous karmic obscurations will also be completely exhausted.

original: bum pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: bum pa'i thabs so //
translated: This is the method of the vase.

original: zhi ba la ni mngar gsum dang 'o ma'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni mngar gsum dang 'o ma'o //
translated: In pacification, there are the three sweets and milk.

original: rgyas pa la ni zas mchog gi gong bu dang yungs kar ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa la ni zas mchog gi gong bu dang yungs kar ro //
translated: In enhancement, there are the best food morsels and mustard seeds.

original: dbang la ni yungs mar dang 'bras rnam pa sna tshogs dang nim pa'i lo ma'o //
analyzed: dbang la ni yungs mar dang 'bras rnam pa sna tshogs dang nim pa'i lo ma'o //
translated: In power, there are mustard oil, various kinds of rice, and neem leaves.

original: drag po la ni sha dang khrag dang dug dang / ske tshe dang til mar ram tshil gzhag go //
analyzed: drag po la ni sha dang khrag dang dug dang / ske tshe dang til mar ram tshil gzhag go //
translated: For the fierce rite, one should place flesh, blood, poison, black mustard seeds, and sesame oil or fat.

original: rig sngags brgya rtsa brgyad pa gsum mam /
analyzed: rig sngags brgya rtsa brgyad pa gsum mam /
translated: One should recite the three sets of one hundred and eight mantras,

original: bdun pa gsum brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdun pa gsum brjod par bya'o //
translated: or the three sets of seven.

original: rig sngags re re zhing rdzas re re dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags re re zhing rdzas re re dbul bar bya'o //
translated: For each mantra, one should offer each substance.

original: zhi ba la ni mthar sv'a h'a brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni mthar sv'a h'a brjod par bya'o //
translated: For the pacifying rite, one should recite svāhā at the end.

original: rgyas pa la aom /
analyzed: rgyas pa la aom /
translated: For the enriching rite, one should recite oṃ.🔽For the summoning rite, one should recite hoḥ.

original: dbang la ho:/ drag po la phat /
analyzed: dbang la ho:/ drag po la phat /
translated: For the fierce rite, one should recite phaṭ.

original: rig sngags 'di yis sv'a h'a la sogs pa mi brjod pa ni phrin las rnam bzhi'i spyi las pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags 'di yis sv'a h'a la sogs pa mi brjod pa ni phrin las rnam bzhi'i spyi las pa'o //
translated: The recitation of these mantras without svāhā and so forth is the general rite of the four activities.

original: til gyi sbyin sreg byas pas mtshams med pa lnga nas nyes pa phra mo yan chad 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: til gyi sbyin sreg byas pas mtshams med pa lnga nas nyes pa phra mo yan chad 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By performing a homa with sesame seeds, one will purify from the five heinous crimes down to the most subtle misdeeds.

original: de la rig sngags lan re zhing rdzas lan re dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rig sngags lan re zhing rdzas lan re dbul bar bya'o //
translated: For that, one should offer each substance once for each mantra.

original: de la grangs ni brgya rtsa brgyad pa gsum dbul bar bya'o//
analyzed: de la grangs ni brgya rtsa brgyad pa gsum dbul bar bya'o//
translated: For that, one should offer three sets of one hundred and eight recitations.

original: @260a * // than rig sngags gcig tsam til gcig tsam thab tu dor na yang sdig ba 'byang bar 'gyur na mang ba rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: @260a * // than rig sngags gcig tsam til gcig tsam thab tu dor na yang sdig ba 'byang bar 'gyur na mang ba rnams lta ci smos /
translated: If even a single mantra or a single sesame seed is cast into the fire, sins will be purified, let alone many.

original: sdig pa 'byang ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa 'byang ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of purifying sins.

original: de la ro bsreg pa ni dong gi nang du chos kyi 'khor lo bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ro bsreg pa ni dong gi nang du chos kyi 'khor lo bri bar bya'o //
translated: In that case, the funeral pyre should be drawn as the wheel of Dharma in the center of the pit.

original: chos kyi yi ge rnams kyang bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi yi ge rnams kyang bri bar bya'o //
translated: The letters of the Dharma should also be drawn.

original: shing brtsigs ba thogs gsum dang ldan par byas la /🔽steng khang la skar khung byas /
analyzed: shing brtsigs ba thogs gsum dang ldan par byas la / steng khang la skar khung byas /
translated: The stacked wood should be made to have three layers.🔽A skylight should be made in the upper story.

original: ro kha nub phyogs su bstan la bzhag go //
analyzed: ro kha nub phyogs su bstan la bzhag go //
translated: The corpse should be placed facing west.

original: ro'i snying gar 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa /
analyzed: ro'i snying gar 'khor lo rtsibs bcu drug pa /
translated: At the heart of the corpse, a sixteen-spoked wheel should be drawn.

original: ras sam gro ga'am shing shun la bris te /
analyzed: ras sam gro ga'am shing shun la bris te /
translated: It should be drawn on cloth, birch bark, or a tree leaf.

original: dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: dgab par bya'o //
translated: It should be covered.

original: 'khor lo la chos kyi ye ge dgod pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo la chos kyi ye ge dgod pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The letters of the Dharma on the wheel are the wheel of Dharma.

original: de'i dbus kyi lte ba nas gzungs thag bsgril ba drangs la bsngo ba mkhan gyis gzung ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte ba nas gzungs thag bsgril ba drangs la bsngo ba mkhan gyis gzung ste /
translated: The dhāraṇī thread should be drawn from the center of that hub. The one who dedicates should hold it.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya rig sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya rig sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this knowledge-mantra of the Dharma-seal.

original: 'di'i bsam pa ni rig sngags 'di brjod pas chos kyi yi ge rnams gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i bsam pa ni rig sngags 'di brjod pas chos kyi yi ge rnams gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The idea is that by reciting this knowledge-mantra, the letters of the Dharma become clear.

original: chos kyi yi ge gsal bas dbus kyi yi ge aom gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi yi ge gsal bas dbus kyi yi ge aom gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the letters of the Dharma are clear, the central letter Oṃ becomes clear.

original: aom ye shes kyi mi 'byung bas phung po tshig bas ye shes lnga'i 'od zer 'phros pas /
analyzed: aom ye shes kyi mi 'byung bas phung po tshig bas ye shes lnga'i 'od zer 'phros pas /
translated: Since Oṃ is the source of wisdom, the aggregates are burned up, and light rays of the five wisdoms radiate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa ni /🔽rgyud las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa ni / rgyud las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin mchod par bya'o //
translated: The offering to all the Tathāgatas is as taught in the tantra.

original: sems can rnams la bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams la bsngo ba ni /
translated: The dedication to sentient beings is as follows:

original: dbang po lnga'i longs spyod du 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod char bzhin 'bab par dmigs te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i longs spyod du 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod char bzhin 'bab par dmigs te /
translated: One visualizes the enjoyments of the five sense objects falling like rain for the enjoyment of the five sense faculties.

original: de nas sngags mkhan gyi rdzas re re la rig sngags lan re re brjod pas brgya rtsa brgyad pa gsum dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags mkhan gyi rdzas re re la rig sngags lan re re brjod pas brgya rtsa brgyad pa gsum dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, for each substance of the mantra practitioner, by reciting the knowledge-mantra once, one should offer three hundred and eight times.

original: sreg rdzas ni yam shing 'o ma can dang / mar dang til la sogs pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sreg rdzas ni yam shing 'o ma can dang / mar dang til la sogs pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The burnt offerings are the oblations of milk-wood, ghee, sesame seeds, and so forth.

original: mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa'i bstod pa bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa'i bstod pa bya'o //
translated: One should praise with the one hundred and eight names.

original: bkra shis par bya ba'i phyir gong du bstan pa'i phrin las rnam pa bzhi char bya'o //
analyzed: bkra shis par bya ba'i phyir gong du bstan pa'i phrin las rnam pa bzhi char bya'o //
translated: For the sake of auspiciousness, one should perform all four of the above activities.

original: de nas bsngo ba mkhan gyis tshe thal ba dang / sems can gyi las gsum pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsngo ba mkhan gyis tshe thal ba dang / sems can gyi las gsum pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the one who is dedicating should dedicate the ashes of the deceased and the three actions of sentient beings to unsurpassed awakening.

original: de la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni /
analyzed: de la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni /
translated: Turning the Dharma wheel is as follows.

original: bsngo ba mkhan gyis bskor ba dang / sngags mkhan gyis ro'i dbus su bskor ba phrin las rnam bzhi'i don du bskor ba ni /
analyzed: bsngo ba mkhan gyis bskor ba dang / sngags mkhan gyis ro'i dbus su bskor ba phrin las rnam bzhi'i don du bskor ba ni /
translated: The one who is dedicating turns the wheel, and the mantra practitioner turns the wheel in the center of the corpse for the sake of the four activities.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum du bskor ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa gsum du bskor ba'o //
translated: Turning the wheel is turning the three types of Dharma wheels.

original: lan bcu gnyis su bskor ba ni /🔽rdo rje sems dpa' nas rdo rje khu tshur du bskor ba ni zhi ba'o //🔽rdo rje rin chen nas rdo rje legs par bskor ba ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: lan bcu gnyis su bskor ba ni / rdo rje sems dpa' nas rdo rje khu tshur du bskor ba ni zhi ba'o // rdo rje rin chen nas rdo rje legs par bskor ba ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: Turning the wheel twelve times is as follows.🔽Turning from Vajrasattva to Vajra Fist is for pacifying.🔽Turning from Vajraratna to Vajra Sādhu is for increasing.

original: rdo rje chos nas rdo rje bzhad pa la bskor ba ni dbang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje chos nas rdo rje bzhad pa la bskor ba ni dbang ngo //
translated: Turning from Vajradharma to Vajra Smiliṅ is for power.

original: rdo rje las nas rdo rje smra ba la @260b thug pa ni drag pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las nas rdo rje smra ba la @260b thug pa ni drag pa'o //
translated: From the vajra action up to the vajra speech, it is wrathful.

original: de rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'o //
translated: It is turned twelve times.

original: gong du bskor ba thams cad de ltar bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bskor ba thams cad de ltar bskor bar bya'o //
translated: All the above turnings should be turned in that way.

original: yi ge brgya pa'i cho ga slob dpon padmas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa'i cho ga slob dpon padmas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The ritual of the hundred syllables composed by Master Padma is complete.
